entry.title: Crypto’s Massive Role In Fatal Fentanyl Trade Revealed In New DOJ Statement
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrencies have taken center stage in a significant crackdown on the illicit production and distribution of fentanyl and methamphetamine. In a significant move against the illicit production of these dangerous drugs, the Department of Justice (DOJ) has unsealed eight indictments.
The indictments also encompassed crimes associated with the sale of precursor chemicals, shining a light on the multifaceted nature of the illegal drug trade.
What sets this operation apart is the integration of cryptocurrency into the criminal enterprise, allowing wrongdoers to conceal their identities and obscure financial trails.
Cryptocurrency’s Role In The Illicit Drug Trade
The Department of Justice revealed that the individuals involved in these criminal activities had adopted various paym…

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Day in Court: What Really Happened at FTX?
entry.summary: On the second day of Sam Bankman-Fried's trial, the US Department of Justice (DOJ) claimed that his crypto business had problems from the beginning. The Assistant US Attorney Nathan Rehn described him as someone who deceived customers and used their money for his own gain, including wealth and political influence, as reported by Coindesk. According to Rehn, Bankman-Fried diverted customers' funds to a "smaller and secretive" company called Alameda Research, using them for personal luxuries and political donations. The prosecution alleges that Bankman-Fried took over $10 billion from FTX to settle Alameda Research's debts and attempted to cover up his actions by creating false financial statements. Allegations Against Sam Bankman-Fried Rehn argues that Bankman-Fried directed…

entry.title: Bitcoin HODLing: Over 50% Of BTC Supply Unmoved Since 5+ Years Ago
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows more than 50% of the Bitcoin supply in circulation has remained dormant since at least five years ago.
Bitcoin Supply Aged More Than 5 Years Is Only Continuing To Grow
In a new post on X, analyst James V. Straten shared a chart that reveals the supply distribution of coins aged more than five years. The investors with coins this old make up a segment of the “long-term holders (LTHs),” which is a cohort that includes all addresses carrying their Bitcoin since at least 155 days ago.
Statistically, the longer an investor holds onto their coins, the less likely they become to sell or transfer the coins at any point. Due to this reason, the LTHs are the resolute hands of the market, who rarely sell even during periods of high profits or losses.
Since the investors …

entry.summary: In the heart of Manhattan, high above Hudson Yards in a bustling hotel, Bitcoin Magazine’s Editor in Chief, Mark Goodwin, sat down with US presidential hopeful Robert F. Kennedy Jr. for a candid and engaging interview that shed new light on his political vision. The interview commenced with RFK's assessment of the Democratic Party and the evolving definition of a "Kennedy Democrat." According to him, Kennedy Democrats are rooted in the party's historical values of advocating for the working class, environmental stewardship, anti-war principles, and skepticism towards corporate influence. He emphasized the need to counter the undue influence of financial giants like BlackRock, State Street, and Vanguard, which control a significant portion of the economy, including military contractors, agr…

In the interview with crypto Youtuber Bad Anthony, the crypto investor “Shitoshi” revealed how he made one of the greatest trades of all time, if not the greatest.
According to the crypto investor, he first gained interest in Shiba Inu during the early days of Shiba Inu back in August 2020. He revealed that he had invested $8,000 in the SHIB back in August 2020, when the token began trading. The token had been brought to his attention by his friends who apparently also invested in it.

entry.summary:
Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), the disgraced co-founder of the now insolvent cryptocurrency exchange FTX, concluded his first day of trial involving jury selection and voir dire questioning. The process extended into Wednesday as U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan eliminated several potential jurors on Tuesday.
Trial of FTX Co-Founder SBF Unveils Juror Crypto Losses on Day One of Voir Dire
A day earlier, on Tuesday, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) appeared in the courtroom sporting a considerably shorter haircut and accompanied by his legal counsel. entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Trial Commences with 12-Judge Jury Selection
entry.summary: Judge Lewis Kaplan, the presiding judge in Sam Bankman-Fried’s case, has unveiled a panel of 12 jurors and six alternates who will be sworn in, marking the beginning of a trial that has garnered significant attention. A jury of twelve New York judges, including a physician's assistant, a librarian, and a nurse, has been chosen to decide the fate of Bankman-Fried, Coindesk initially reported. Their deliberations will determine whether he is guilty of fraud and conspiracy charges in a case in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York. The U.S. Prosecutors have filed multiple charges of fraud and conspiracy against Bankman-Fried following the collapse of his crypto-trading platform, FTX. Prosecutors allege that the 31-year-old entrepreneur misappropriat…

entry.summary:
Shiba Inu (SHIB) enthusiasts have long harbored a fervent aspiration: to see the meme coin achieve the elusive one-cent mark. While the current SHIB price, standing at $0.00000726 according to CoinGecko, might seem far away from this dream, the community remains steadfast in its hope.

The question looms large: how can SHIB traverse the monumental gap between its current value and the coveted one-cent milestone?

entry.title: Why UK’s FCA Plans To Launch Another Digital Securities Sandbox
entry.summary:
The United Kingdom’s Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is about to launch its second crypto sandbox, which comprises set rules to govern digital securities. According to the FCA’s head of capital markets, Helen Boyd, the UK Treasury will release the Digital Securities Sandbox in Q1 of 2024.
This development comes about two months after the FCA permanently rolled out the UK’s first Digital Sandbox on August 1. The first sandbox comprised data sets and insights designed to foster innovation and growth and encourage international competitiveness for tech startups.
UK Treasuries Introduces Sandbox To Encourage Digital Securities Adoption
During the CCData Digital Asset Summit on October 3, Helen Boyd announced that the Royal Treasury will launch the new sandbox by the end of the first q…

entry.title: DOJ Clamps Down on SBF’s Regulatory Loophole Defense Amid Ongoing Fraud Trial
entry.summary:
The Department of Justice (DOJ) has asked the judge in Sam Bankman-Fried’s (SBF) criminal case to restrict several planned defense arguments about financial regulations. Prosecutors said in a new court filing that SBF should not be allowed to claim he’s innocent because cryptocurrency exchanges faced little regulation. They also argued he can’t use his compliance with U.S. laws as proof of good faith.
Prosecutors Seek to Limit SBF’s Defense Arguments About Regulations
In the Wednesday letter, federal prosecutors asked U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan to reconsider or clarify a recent order limiting trial evidence. They aim to block Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) from arguing that FTX’s lack of U.S. oversight made his actions legal. Prosecutors called the alleged claim “inaccurate” and “highly…

entry.title: Bitfinex’s Role in Taming Crypto Market Volatility: Resilience at Its Core
entry.summary:
Understanding volatility in the crypto market
The world of cryptocurrencies is known for its volatility, with prices fluctuating wildly within short periods. For traders, the ability to navigate and even capitalize on this is crucial to success. Understanding volatility in the crypto market is the first step to mastering it. Volatility refers to the rapid and significant price movements that cryptocurrencies experience. These price fluctuations can be caused by various factors, such as market sentiment, regulatory changes, economic events, or even social media trends.
To become a successful crypto trader, one must develop resilience in the face of volatility. Resilience is the ability to adapt and recover quickly from market fluctuations. It involves strategies and tools that enable tr…

entry.title: XRP Price Surges To $0.54, Here’s Why
entry.summary:
Amid crypto prices being on a tear this week, with Bitcoin crossing above $28,000 in the early hours of Monday, the XRP price has done particularly well, rising over $0.54 in the past 24 hours.
Apart from the overall market strength, some factors have contributed to XRP’s current strength, ranging from easing legal troubles to Ripple getting a new money license in Asia.
Ripple Updates Push XRP Price Surge
XRP price has witnessed sustained buying pressure this week as positive news swirls around the Ripple ecosystem to increase confidence from buyers. For one, Ripple’s legal issues seem to be easing as the payments technology company recently scored another win in court.
On October 3, federal Judge Analisa Torres dismissed the SEC’s interlocutory appeal motion against the rulin…

entry.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head
entry.summary: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.

entry.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery
entry.summary: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.

entry.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2
entry.summary: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: “If you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,” he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. “That's something that's caused a lot of issues.”

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges
entry.summary: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto
entry.summary: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
